business.headline: Aviation regulator suspends 2 Akasa Air officials for lapses in pilots trainingThe two senior executives of the airline have reportedly failed to ensure compliances with the civil aviation requirements, Directorate General of Civil Aviation said.
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revives debate on 70-hour work weekZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu weighs in on the 70-hour work week debate initiated by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy. Here's his perspective.
Will DA rise again in 2025? All you need to knowCentral government employees await a potential DA hike in January 2025, which could offer modest relief amid rising costs
Sensex, Nifty rise for 2nd straight day as auto stocks rally The S&P BSE Sensex settled 226.59 points higher at 78,690.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.20 points to end at 23,813.40.

How Manmohan Singh revitalised India's economy and global standingAs the chief architect of India's 1991 economic liberalisation, Manmohan Singh's policies helped steer India away from a severe financial crisis, positioning the country as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Osamu Suzuki, former Suzuki Motor Corporation chairman, dies at 94Osamu Suzuki steered Suzuki Motor's rise, from pioneering Maruti 800 in India to building a global automotive legacy.

How Indian stock market benefitted under Manmohan SinghManmohan Singh's policies, introduced during a time of economic crisis in the early 1990s, reshaped India's economy and transformed the Indian stock markets.

10 income tax changes in 2024: What you need to know for filing ITR in 2025The 2024 income tax reforms introduce revised tax slabs, higher deductions, and simplified TDS and capital gains rules, making tax filing easier and offering potential savings.

Bumper stock market debut for Mamata Machinery: Should you book profit or wait? Mamata Machinery stock market listing: A 147% premium debut for Mamata Machinery leaves investors wondering: Is this the peak, or should they hold on?

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong market debut: Is it a long-term bet?DAM Capital Advisors market listing: The listing matched market predictions, as analysts and the grey market premium (GMP) had anticipated a 40%-50% premium, driven by robust demand and positive sentiment.

Sanathan Textiles shares list at 31% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell? Sanathan Textiles stock market debut: The listing comes after the company's initial public offering (IPO) witnessed robust demand, with subscriptions exceeding 36 times the total shares on offer.

Explained: Why Mazagon Dock share price is down 50% on some trading apps todayMazagon Dock stock price: Certain trading apps may be displaying the unadjusted previous closing price, leading to the perception of a 50% fall. Adjusted for the split, Mazagon Dock shares were trading 2.13% lower on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:09 am.

Transrail Lighting shares list at 36% premium on Dalal Street debut Transrail Lighting share price: The shares opened at Rs 585.15 per share on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The market debut aligns with market expectations, which was oversubscribed by 81 times.

DAM Capital Advisors makes strong debut, shares list at 39% premium DAM Capital Advisors listing: On the BSE, the shares began trading at Rs 392.90, marking a 38.83% premium compared to the issue price.

Mamata Machinery shares make bumper debut with 147% premium over IPO priceMamata Machinery listing: Shares of Mamata Machinery made a bumper debut and listed at Rs 600 per share on the NSE, a lot higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 243 per share.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as auto stocks fuel early rally; Tata Motors up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 323.12 points to 78,795.60, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 101.95 points to 23,852.15 as of 9:44 AM.

Dam Capital to Mamata Machinery: GMPs of 5 IPOs ahead of D-Street debut todayThese initial public offerings (IPOs), which opened for subscription on December 19 and closed on December 23, collectively raised over Rs 2,900 crore.

Manmohan Singh's key reforms that shaped Indian economyDr Manmohan Singh's tenure as Finance Minister in the early 1990s and later as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014 introduced policies that continue to influence India's growth.

Gautam Adani on work-life balance: Spend at least 4 hours with familyChairperson of Adani Group, Gautam Adani, shared his take on work-life balance and said one must try to spend at least four hours with their families.

Government may consider tax relief for income of up to Rs 10.50 lakh: ReportThe move, likely to be announced in the upcoming Budget 2025 on February 1, aims to boost consumption and address concerns over rising living costs amid a slowing economy.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: India bids farewell to Manmohan Singh, last rites conducted with state honours Live UpdatesManmohan Singh was cremated with full state honours today. The Centre agreed to allocate space for a memorial of the former Prime Minister after a war of words broke out between the BJP and the Congress.

Working to stop AAP: Arvind Kejriwal attacks BJP and Congress after probe orderFormer Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday (December 28) attacked the BJP and Congress and accused them of attempting to sabotage Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) welfare schemes.

Cold wave to continue in Delhi as North India braces for chilly start to 2025As intermittent rain continued in several parts of North India, the IMD has predicted a fall in the minimum temperature by 3-5 degrees Celsius in the next two days.

Dreams come true at MCG: How father's sacrifice fuelled Nitish's journeyNitish Kumar Reddy's maiden Test century at the MCG was a historic and emotional moment, showcasing his resilience and honouring his father's sacrifices. The 21-year-old all-rounder scripted a remarkable recovery for India in the Boxing Day Test.

Manjummel Boys to Aavesham: 2024 truly belonged to Malayalam cinema From big hits to bigger misses to the explosive Hema Committee report, Malayalam cinema experienced highs and lows in 2024. Here's a round-up of what transpired in Mollywood this year.

Joe Biden, first lady Jill pay tribute to Manmohan Singh: 'True statesman'The former Prime Minister, who was India's first Sikh prime minister, died in New Delhi on Thursday night (December 26). He was 92.

Actor Urmila Kothare's car runs over metro workers in Mumbai, 1 killedAn accident in Mumbai claimed the life of a labourer and left another injured when a car owned by actress Urmila Kothare rammed into them in Kandivali.

Twin brothers' robbery trick busted: One stole while other created CCTV alibiTwin brothers Saurabh and Sanjeev Verma used a deceptive scheme where one committed a robbery while the other provided an alibi using CCTV footage, a tactic recently uncovered by the police leading to their arrest.
Sikandar teaser: Salman Khan gears up for high-octane action on Eid 2025Salman Khan's Sikandar teaser is finally out. The movie, directed by AR Murugadoss, will release in theatres on Eid 2025.

Sparkling Nitish hundred, Sundar rearguard cut India's deficit on Day 3Australia vs India: Nitish Reddy's maiden Test hundred, combined with Washington Sundar's fighting fifty, helped India cut Australia's first-innings lead on Day 3 of the ongoing Boxing Day Test.

'Stealing' the spotlight: Australian store's invite to 'rob' sees stampedeAs soon as the store in Perth opened its shutters on Thursday, hundreds of teens pushed and shoved their way into the shop, resulting in a massive stampede.

How Dubai kunafa chocolate went viral and inspired a global trendUnless you've been living under a rock, you're likely aware of just how viral Dubai's kunafa chocolates have gone. Experts suggest that this widespread appeal heralds a brilliant business opportunity.

Amid Manmohan Singh's memorial row, Pranab Mukherjee's daughter's dig at CongressSharmistha Mukherjee criticised the party for demanding a separate memorial space for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh while failing to convene a Working Committee meeting to condole her father's death.

AAP's women scheme, Punjab intel officers in Delhi: Lt Governor orders probeThe directives were issued by Delhi's Lieutenant Governor to the chief secretary and the Commissioner of Police following complaints by Congress's Sandeep Dikshit.

Manmohan Singh: Accidental PM, but not an accidental politicianManmohan Singh served as the Prime Minister of India for 10 years, but people still perceive that he was politically naive. That couldn't be further from the truth. Singh survived in the Congress by picking his battles well even as astute politicians fell along the way.

Viral: Anushka Sharma's pic with cricketer Nitish Reddy's family in AustraliaActor Anushka Sharma's picture happily posing with Indian cricketer Nitish Kumar Reddy's family in Australia has gone viral. The actor accompanied her cricketer husband Virat Kohli for the 2024-25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

How a housewife who hated washing dishes invented the dishwasher in 1886Josephine Garis Cochran had no formal training in mechanical engineering, but in the 1880s, she designed, built, marketed, and sold her own dishwashing machine. In 2006, she was posthumously honoured by being inducted into the National Inventors Hall of Fame.

Bodycam footage shows US prison officers thrashing handcuffed inmate before deathBody camera footage of the assault on Robert Brooks was made public by the New York attorney general, and shows correctional officers beating the handcuffed man, striking him in the chest with a shoe, and lifting him by the neck.

Carlsen trolls Chess Federation with OOTD post after quitting championshipThe world's best chess player Magnus Carlsen quit the 2024 World Rapid and Blitz Championship after being fined by FIDE over dress code. Carlsen trolled the tournament with a cheeky post on social media after quitting.

Bengaluru man turns cab driver at 3 am as sleepy chauffeur hands over keys. VideoSharing a video in a post on Instagram, a Bengaluru-based founder narrated the story when he ended up driving his own cab at 3am after his drowsy driver could no longer stay awake.

Republican candidate's mock execution of migrant in video: 'Deserve to be ended'In the video, Valentina Gomez is seen firing a handgun into the back of the head of a dummy tied to a chair with a black bag over its head. She asserts that undocumented persons who commit violent crimes "deserve to be ended."

Not his well-wishers: Supreme Court raps farm leaders over Dallewal's healthFarmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has been on a fast-unto-death since November 26 to press the Centre to accept the demand of MSP for crops.

Family, friends, fireworks: Inside Salman Khan's grand birthday bash in JamnagarSalman Khan, along with his family, celebrated his 59th birthday in Jamnagar. Several pictures from the grand bash have emerged online.

Sikandar teaser X reactions: Fans call Salman Khan 'badass', say 'bhai is back'The highly-anticipated teaser of Salman Khan's upcoming film Sikandar was unveiled today, sending fans into a frenzy online. Enthusiastic users hailed the mass actioner, declaring it a "blockbuster in the making."
Sikandar teaser: Salman Khan gears up for high-octane action on Eid 2025Salman Khan's Sikandar teaser is finally out. The movie, directed by AR Murugadoss, will release in theatres on Eid 2025.

Video: Katrina Kaif-Vicky Kaushal return from holiday ahead of New YearKatrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal returned to Mumbai after their Christmas holiday. The couple had also shared pictures from their perfect getaway.

sports.headline: Nitish Reddy impressed me from 1st Test: Sachin Tendulkar praises MCG starSachin Tendulkar lauded Nitish Kumar Reddy's composure during his maiden Test hundred at the MCG, calling it "a knock to remember." He also praised Washington Sundar's valuable support in a crucial 127-run partnership that kept India in contention.

Nitish Reddy should go up the order to correct the balance of the side: ShastriFormer India cricketer and head coach has suggested promoting all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy up the order after his magnificent maiden century on Day 3 of the fourth Test against Australia in Melbourne.

Watch: Nitish Kumar Reddy gets emotional on meeting family after MCG heroicsNitish Kumar Reddy's emotional reunion with his family after his maiden Test century at the MCG highlighted years of sacrifice and resilience. Tears flowed as his heroic knock became a testament to his hard work and unwavering family support.

Washington reveals 'fight no matter what' attitude behind MCG heroicsWashington Sundar credited India's fightback to the dressing room's message of unwavering fighting spirit, led by Gautam Gambhir and Rohit Sharma, as he and Nitish Kumar Reddy stitched a crucial 127-run partnership in the Melbourne Test.

Nitish Reddy dedicates maiden Test hundred to his father: This one's for you dadNitish Reddy's maiden Test century at the MCG was an emotional tribute to his father's sacrifices. Overcoming financial struggles, Nitish's journey reached a historic high as he dedicated his Boxing Day hundred to his teary-eyed father.

Nitish Reddy's witty post for Siraj after MCG hundred: I also believe in Siraj bhaiIndia all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy praised his teammate Mohammed Siraj with a witty social media post as he played a pivotal role in helping him complete his maiden Test hundred in Melbourne.

Pathum Nissanka's 90 in vain as New Zealand take 1-0 lead in thriller NZ vs SL: New Zealand took a 1-0 lead in the three-match T20I series after beating Sri Lanka by eight runs on Saturday at the Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui. Jacob Duffy won the Player of the Match award while Daryl Mitchell and Michael Bracewell scored fifties.

A new star has arrived: How pundits and greats reacted to Nitish's MCG 105Nitish Kumar Reddy's maiden Test century at the MCG rescued India from a dire situation, showcasing his immense talent and composure. The young all-rounder's historic knock earned him praise and cemented his place as a future cricketing star.

Mayank Agarwal hits consecutive hundreds in Vijay Hazare Trophy for KarnatakaMayank Agarwal's fiery 45-ball century led Karnataka to a dominant 10-wicket win over Arunachal in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. With 304 runs in four matches, including two tons, Mayank's sensational form continues to power Karnataka's campaign.

His 105-run knock from No. 8 earned widespread praise, including admiration from cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar.

Nitish Kumar Reddy's MCG century will be remembered forever: Sundar AUS vs IND: Washington Sundar lauded Nitish Kumar Reddy for scoring his maiden Test hundred in front of a packed crowd at the Melbourne Cricket Ground in the Boxing Day Test.

Washington Sundar justifies Boxing Day selection with gritty 50 in MCG rearguardAustralia vs India: India's Washington Sundar justified his Boxing Day selection with a gritty Test fifty in the rare rearguard to help India cut their first-innings deficit on Day 3. Sunday shared a 127-run stand with the centurion Nitish Kumar Reddy in Melbourne.

Nitish Reddy's father in tears after prayers answered for son's MCG hundredIND vs AUS: Nitish Kumar Reddy's father was in tears after his son's nervy century in the Boxing Day Test. Nitish created history by becoming the first India No.8 to score a hundred in Australia.

Nitish Reddy hits maiden Test hundred, scripts history in Melbourne IND vs AUS: Nitish Kumar Reddy became the first No.8 batter to score a Test hundred at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. The youngster reached the landmark on Day 3 of the Boxing Day Test.

Justin Langer picks 'gladiatorial' Virat Kohli over Tendulkar, LaraIND vs AUS: Former Australia batter Justin Langer picked Virat Kohli as the best player he had ever seen. Langer picked Kohli ahead of Sachin Tendulkar and Brian Lara.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
